lines.text: You're huntin' it, ain't ya? Yeah, you're huntin' it alright. Just like me.
What are you hunting, Mr. Sayer?

Apocalypse, End of the World, Armageddon. It's always got a face and a name. I've been huntin' the bastard for 30 years, give or take. Come close a time or two. Too damn close! You can't kill damnation, Mister. It don't die like a man dies.
I know that, Mr. Sayer.
Ten years ago, he tried to kill Laurie Strode. Now he wants her daughter.
Are you talkin' about Jamie Lloyd?
Wherever she is, that little child is in mortal danger.
Myers has been locked up since before she was born. He's never laid eyes on her!

Six bodies, Sheriff! That's what I've seen between here and Ridgemont! A filling station in flames! I'm telling you Michael Myers is here, in this town! He's here to kill that little girl and anybody who gets in his way!
What are we doin'?
Making sure no one can get in here.
Isn't all this a little paranoid?
If you'd seen that police station, you wouldn't even ask.
[Rachel catches Brady with Kelly]
I mean, you blow off our date at the last minute...
So you hop on to the next best thing? I thought you were different from other guys.
Oh, I'm different, it's just, it's just that... I just, I just got pissed off, that's all.
Oh really? Well, I'll just let you get back to little Miss Hot Panties.
This is starting to spook me here, doc.
At least I'm not alone.
Martians could land on Ben's doorstep and all he'd do is spit once and get himself a shotgun.
We're not talking about any ordinary prisoner, Hoffman! We are talking about evil on two legs.
Maybe nobody knows how to stop him. But I've gotta try.
Oh yeah... I catch you gropin' my daughter, I'll use that shotgun on you. You understand?
[Brady nods "yes"]
[the power worker sees Michael Myers]
Hey, you! This is city property! No trespassing! What are you, deaf? Don't try that Halloween shit with me.

Yeah, the one you're picking up, just thinkin' about him gives me the 'willies.' A decade ago-Halloween night-he murdered sixteen people, maybe more, trying to get to his sister. Nearly got her, too. But his doctor, of all people, shot him six times, then he set him on fire. Both of them nearly burned to death. Yeah, I'll be glad to see this one gone. Oh yes, indeed-dee!
[at Ridgemont; a loud, distant shriek]
Jesus!
Jesus ain't got nothin' to do with this place.
I didn't know you and Brady had anything, okay?
You knew. You just didn't care.
He's not married. Besides, I've got a right to do what's best for me.
Don't you mean what you do best?
Wise up to what men want, Rachel... or Brady won't be the last man you lose to another woman.
[Earl and his men have mistakenly shot and killed an innocent man]
Shit, Earl. It's Ted Hollister.

[to Orrin]
You dumb son of a bitch. You said you saw Myers.
[the attendants are in the ambulance with Michael Myers, unaware that he is coming out of his coma]
Did Hoffman say anything about living relatives?
Yeah. A niece living in his hometown.
And?
"And?" She's too young to be his legal ward.
So the state owns him? Great.
[Loomis and Dr. Hoffman arrive at a river where the ambulance containing Michael Myers crashed into]
When did this happen?
Sometime in the night. They probably lost the road in the storm and came down the embankment. It happens.
An accident?
Yes, sir?
Do you believe that?
Why shouldn't I?
We have to get out of Haddonfield. The state police are on their way. Let them handle it.
I don't know about you, Earl, but that makes sense to me. Let's get the hell out!
We've got a police station. Let the troopers have him. That's what they get paid for.
Screw it. Let's get out of here.
You've going to have to watch, Jamie tonight.
Not tonight, I've got that date with Brady. You know, how important that is.
It's an important night, for me and your father.
Can't you find somebody, else?
It's too late.
What am I suppose to tell Brady, "I'm sorry, I have to watch my foster sister, go on and have fun by yourself,"
It's not exactly, the end of the world for goodness sake.
Sure it is, Brady and I were going to make a commitment. My engagement, my marriage, and my kids and, your grandchildren are wiped out, and I have to babysit.

[Angrily]
I'm sorry I ruined everything, if I wasn't here you can go out.
[Rachel moans in disgust]
Good job Rachel, we've given that little girl all the love we've gave her right now. All you do is, think about yourself.
You're talking about him as if he were a human being. That part of him died years ago.
We'll hear some sirens soon.
Then we'll be safe?
Yeah.
You don't believe that, do you?
[checks door, then pauses]
No...
[after all the cops at the station are slaughtered]
How could a man do this, Loomis? Tell me.
This isn't a man.
What is he? Tell me! What the hell are we dealing with?
Evil.
Hey, I got a town full of beer bellies running around in the dark with shotguns! Who's gonna be next? Somebody's wife? Somebody's kid? I can't stand by for that.
You never get used to the faces. Never!
I need to speak with Sheriff Brackett.
Well, then you'll have to travel about three-thousand miles south of here.
What?
Brackett retired in '81. He went to St. Petersburg.
[Wade is waiting to approach Kelly]
Hey, Wade, why don't you go ahead and make your move?
Don't rush me, Brady. Timing's got to be primo.
Yeah, well, money talks and bullshit walks. You know what I mean?
Oh come alive, Rachel. Please come alive! Don't be dead. You can't be dead! Come alive, Rachel!

[encounters the Shape in gas station]
Michael? Why now? You waited ten years. I knew this day would come. Don't go to Haddonfield. If you want another victim, take me. But leave those people in peace. Please, Michael?
[pause]
Goddamn you.
[Loomis shoots straight]
I'd assume Dr. Loomis would be here. Michael Myers is still his patient.
If Loomis read memos he'd be here. Fortunately, his position is more ceremonial than medical. And with Myers gone, my hope is that he'll either transfer, retire, or die.
Why wasn't I notified?
About what?
You know damn well about what! You let them take it out of here!
Now where are you going?
Haddonfield. It's a four hour drive. You can reach me through the local police. If you don't find him in four hours, I'm sure I will.
Let it be, Earl. Let the police handle it.
Like the last time? How many people killed back then? How many kids?
We'll be at the Fallbrooks. The number's next to the phone.
I know, and next to that is police, hospital, fire, and probably the National Guard.
You're gonna be late. You don't wanna blow your promotion.
Don't make fun. Tonight is the difference between vacations in Bermuda, and spending another two weeks with your grandmother in Cleveland.
Whoever you are, I have a big dog with me, and he bites!
